{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20803v1", "title": "Continuation maps for the Morse fundamental group", "summary": "We study properties of the continuation map for the Morse fundamental group
$\pi_1^\text{Morse}(f,\ast)$ associated to a Morse-Smale pair $(f,g)$ on a
manifold $M$. We get a morphism between $\pi_1^\text{Morse}(f_1,\ast_1)$ and
$\pi_1^\text{Morse}(f_2,\ast_2)$ and show that it is functorial. We also define
the morphism in the case of Morse data over different manifolds, thanks to the
use of grafted trajectories. Finally, given an interpolation function on
$M\times\mathbb{R}$ between two Morse functions (used for example to define the
continuation map), we study the Morse fundamental group associated to that
function and show that it is isomorphic to a relative fundamental group on
$M\times\mathbb{R}$.", "main_category": "math.GT", "categories": "math.GT,math.DG,math.SG", "published": "2025-04-29T14:15:53Z"}
